intro: Ipomopsis minutiflora, commonly known as the small-flowered morning glory, is a herbaceous plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its delicate, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pale blue to lavender, typically blooming in the morning. The plant has hairy stems and leaves that are opposite and ovate, with finely toothed margins. It thrives in rocky soils and arid environments, often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats. Ipomopsis minutiflora is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, which includes many flowering plants with coiled stems and showy flowers.
